value.title: ‘I have no desire to wipe out humans,’ robot writes in ominous op-ed
value.excerpt: OpenAI’s powerful new language generator, saying exactly what a robot intending to destroy humans might say. In an op-ed for The Guardian — yes, robots write op-eds now — GPT-3 was told to write an essay convincing readers that the machines come in peace.

value.title: Nigeria to establish centre for artificial intelligence, robotics
value.excerpt: The National Information Technology Development Agency (NITDA) has said it is set to establish a Centre for Artificial Intelligence and Robotics in Nigeria.

value.title: Space the place for Irish AI chip as PhiSat-1 satellite blasts off
value.excerpt: An artificial intelligence (AI) processing chip developed in Ireland has been included on board a satellite that blasted off into space from French Guiana early this morning. The PhiSat-1 is the first European satellite carrying out an experiment to demonstrate how on-board deep-learning technology can speed up the rate at which observation data is processed and transmitted to Earth.

value.title: XRobotics is keeping the dream of pizza robots alive
value.excerpt: Zume pulled the plug on its robotic pizza wing earlier this year. A lot goes into making a decision like that — particularly for a company whose robotic dreams were a press darling for a while there.

value.title: Elon Musk unveils updated Neuralink brain implant design and surgical robot
value.excerpt: Elon Musk's neuroscience startup Neuralink has revealed the "dramatically simplified" design for an implant that aims to create brain-to-machine interfaces, alongside the robot that will insert it and several pigs that have the device installed.
